org.arl.fjage.shell

Class WebShell

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.shell.WebShell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shell

    public class WebShell
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shell
    Web-based command shell.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebShell(int port)
      Creates a web command shell running on a specified port and root context.
      WebShell(int port, java.lang.String path)
      Creates a web command shell running on a specified port and context path.
      WebShell(java.lang.String path)
      Creates a web command shell without a web server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebShell

        public WebShell(int port,
                java.lang.String path)
        Creates a web command shell running on a specified port and context path.
        Parameters:
        port - TCP port number (0 to automatically select port).
        path - context path.

      • WebShell

        public WebShell(int port)
        Creates a web command shell running on a specified port and root context.
        Parameters:
        port - TCP port number (0 to automatically select port).

      • WebShell

        public WebShell(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a web command shell without a web server. The shell's context handler should later be added to an existing web server.
        Parameters:
        path - context path.

      • setCSS

        public void setCSS(java.lang.String style)
        Sets the CSS stylesheet. The stylesheet may be null, if no stylesheet desired. If the full HTML is specified using setHtml() then the stylesheet is ignored.
        Parameters:
        style - CSS code.

      • getHtml

        public java.lang.String getHtml()
        Gets the current HTML code.
        Returns:
        HTML code.

      • setHtmlBody

        public void setHtmlBody(java.lang.String body)
        Sets the HTML code to be served.
        Parameters:
        body - HTML body code.

      • setHtml

        public void setHtml(java.lang.String body)
        Sets the HTML code to be served.
        Parameters:
        body - HTML body code.

      • isBare

        public boolean isBare()
        Checks if the HTML code is to be served "as is", or as part of the body.
        Returns:
        true if the code is to be served "as is", false otherwise.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the TCP port of the web server. This should only be called after the web server is started.
        Returns:
        the TCP port of the web server.
